stepTitle:
Chlorine can exist in two forms, gaseous $$Cl_2$$ and solid $$Cl_2$$. Given the following standard entropies and enthalpies of formation, use the Gibbs free energy formula to determine which form of chlorine is more thermodynamically stable at $$298$$ K:

$$Cl_2$$ (gas): ΔH°_f $$=$$ $$0$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$, S° $$=$$ $$223.08$$ $$ rac{J}{mol·K}$$
$$Cl_2$$ (solid): ΔH°_f $$=$$ $$-6.4$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$, S° $$=$$ $$50.00$$ $$ rac{J}{mol·K}$$
